Package user

Class UserAPI

java.lang.Object
user.UserAPI
public class UserAPI extends Object
Interface for accessing user-editable information from the user json file. This most includes graphical settings (font, color, etc.) and basic period information (name, room, teacher). Optionally, the "Days" field can be redefined in the user json file instead of the school json file.

  • Constructor Details

    • UserAPI

      public UserAPI() throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructs a new UserAPI object from the default jar artifact.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the user json file does not exist as a jar artifact.
      IllegalArgumentException - upon any parse error.

    • UserAPI

      public UserAPI(Path path) throws FileNotFoundException
      Constructs a new UserAPI object from a file on the disk.
      Parameters:
      path - a Path object that points to the user json file on the disk.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if path == null.
      FileNotFoundException - if the user json file does not exist.
      IllegalArgumentException - upon any parse error.
      IllegalArgumentException - if OSPath.isInJar(path) is true.

    • UserAPI

      public UserAPI(UserJson json) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs a new UserAPI object from a UserJson object.
      Parameters:
      json - the UserJson object containing user data.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if json == null.
      IllegalArgumentException - upon any parse error.

  • Method Details

    • getSchoolFile

      public Path getSchoolFile()
      Returns the path to the current school json file.
      Returns:
      the path to the current school json file.

    • getAvailableSchools

      public List<String> getAvailableSchools()
      Returns a list of known school json file names.
      Returns:
      a list of known school json file names.

    • getPeriodKeys

      public List<String> getPeriodKeys()
      Returns a list of period names (which should be parsable as integers) in the user json file.
      Returns:
      a list of period names in the user json file. Note that this list may not actually contain strings that are parsable as integers.

    • getPeriod

      public UserPeriod getPeriod(SchoolPeriod schoolPeriod)
      Returns an UserPeriod object for the same period as the given SchoolPeriod. The following UserPeriod will be returned:
      • If schoolPeriod == null, then "Summer | Free" is returned.
      • If schoolPeriod.isFree(), then the school period's name is returned.
      • If the type of schoolPeriod is undefined, then "??? | ???" is returned.
      • Else, the user-defined name is returned.
      Parameters:
      schoolPeriod - the school period to get the corresponding user period for.
      Returns:
      an UserPeriod object for the same period as the given SchoolPeriod.

    • getNextUp

      public String getNextUp()
      Returns the verbosity level of the "next up" feature.
      Returns:
      the verbosity level of the "next up" feature.

    • getTheme

      public int getTheme()
      Returns the theme color chosen by the user, as a 3-byte integer (for rgb).
      Returns:
      the theme color chosen by the user, as a 3-byte integer (for rgb).

    • getFont

      public String getFont()
      Returns the name of the font chosen by the user.
      Returns:
      the name of the font chosen by the user.

    • setSchoolFile

      public void setSchoolFile(Path path)
      Updates the school file being viewed by the user. No change is made if the file is not a valid json file, or is null.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the school file.

    • setPeriod

      public void setPeriod(String key, Map<String,String> value)
      Sets the information for a user-defined class period. If any argument is null, or the value map does not contain all required keys, no change is made.
      Parameters:
      key - the period number being set.
      value - a map with the period teacher, room, and name.

    • setNextUp

      public void setNextUp(String verbosity)
      Sets the verbosity level for the "next up" feature.
      Parameters:
      verbosity - the verbosity level for the "next up" feature.

    • setTheme

      public void setTheme(int r, int g, int b)
      Sets the theme color from an rgb value. If any of the color channels is outside the interval [0, 255], the color being set is forced to white.
      Parameters:
      r - the red channel.
      g - the green channel.
      b - the blue channel.

    • setFont

      public void setFont(String font)
      Sets the name of the font used by the application.
      Parameters:
      font - the name of the font.
